com.quantimodo.android.sdk.login

Class QuantimodoSDKHelper

  • java.lang.Object
    • com.quantimodo.android.sdk.login.QuantimodoSDKHelper

  • public class QuantimodoSDKHelper
extends Object
    Class that encapsulate work with tokens and auth Tokens stored in private shared preferences This class should be use as Singleton, in most cases it would be injected as dependency

      • refreshToken

        public QuantimodoSDKHelper.AuthToken refreshToken()
                                           throws NoNetworkConnection
        Makes request to QuantiModo webservice
        Returns:
        new AuthToken object
        Throws:
        NoNetworkConnection - thrown when refresh failed because of connectivity problems
        IllegalStateException - thrown when the AuthHelper is not initialized or when client id or secret are missing

      • setAuthToken

        public void setAuthToken(QuantimodoSDKHelper.AuthToken token,
                boolean startCallback)
        Set AuthToken to current instance of AuthHelper and save it in storage
        Parameters:
        token -

        public boolean isLoggedIn()
        Checks if user is logged in
        Returns:
        true if user is logged

      • getAuthTokenWithRefresh

        public String getAuthTokenWithRefresh()
                               throws NoNetworkConnection
        Request auth token string, if token is expired AuthHelper would try to refresh it
        Returns:
        token string, usable in requests
        Throws:
        NoNetworkConnection - if refresh failed 2 times because of connectivity problems, this exception would be thrown
